body: AT LEAST half of the serious crimes in Nassau County are committed by New York City residents, police officials say. And, they agree, the problem is getting worse. ''In the last five years there has definitely been a higher influx from the city,'' said Officer John Bartley, a crime analyst in Nassau County's Fifth Precinct, which borders southern
title: CRIME ON L.I.: CITY ROLE IS KEY

body: TABLE MONEY By Jimmy Breslin. 435 pages. Ticknor & Fields. $17.95. IT is easier to write a book about New York than it is to write a good novel about New Yorkers. New York would not, of course, be New York without its special breed of citizens, but New Yorkers are such a diverse lot that it takes a native, or a longtime resident, to sniff out the
title: Books: Another Round

body: ARDENT students of New Yorkiana may find it incomprehensible that their beloved city should be framed in any context that includes the word ''trivia,'' but the trivia passion is upon us and the other day the Weekend Walker was carrying a book that alarmed his constant companion, the City Stroller. The name of the paperback was ''Manhattan Trivia,
title: WEEKEND WALKER AND CITY STROLLER TACKLE NEW YORKIANA
